Reviews.Title: “excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lucy H
Reviews.Content: great room with beam ceiling plus spa bath in bathroom , good breakfasts staff will make you a great cappucino if you dont want machine coffee, great location 2 minutes from termini station , also some great value local restaurants about, staff friendly all in all cant fault my stay and would use again

Reviews.Title: “excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: wagnerfontes2
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable room, good breakfast, excellent location (2min walking from Termini station where you have trains, buses, hop-on-off buses, subway to everywhere). Although there is no landscape from the window and no fancy places around, it is quite convenient to stay there. Staff extremely helpful, polite, friendly and efficient. The noise level in the room is quite low (I totally disagree with the previous comment complaining about it). This hotel gave me the best value for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Johanna o
Reviews.Content: Room nothing special but clean and reasonably comfortable. Bathroom was really nice. No complaints about breakfast, they'll make you a proper cappuccino if you don't fancy the coffee from the machine. Staff was quite friendly- no complaints there! Bed was a bit hard and the TV located to high up (with very few channels in English) but then who comes to Rome to sleep and watch telly? Area isn't great for sightseeing but quite handy for transport. Some people and guide books claim area gets a bit dodgy after dark, we didn't feel unsafe or threatened during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Jill R
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice now. The location is second to none for the Termini in fact you can see the Marsala entrance from the hotel door. The only small criticism would be that the rooms are snug however they are spotlessly clean. All the staff whether reception, waiting or cleaning are helpful and friendly. The breakfasts were varied and plentiful. In fact this hotel would take some beating on price, location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, great value hotel!”
Reviews.Author: epicureglasgow
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its proximity to the Termini, where the Terravsion buses from the airports stop. Considering its central position, it is nonetheless very quiet, due to great double glazing. The staff were friendly, polite and smiley. Breakfast was basic but plentiful, and the waitress even offered all guests bespoke cappucino, latte or espresso coffees from the Gaggia machine! The hotel is scrupulously clean, and our bathroom looked as though it had been installed yesterday! Ideal position, on all the main train, tram, bus and Metro routes. A huge variety of restaurants on the doorstep, Restaurante da Nazzareno and Restaurante Mino being particularly fine. Would recommend this great value hotel to anyone! The review by sarah795 is amazing. They were checking out as we were having breakfast, and my wife and I could not believe how rude and aggressive they were being to the reception staff while trying to get away without paying a national tax (of a whole 2 Euros)! Don't believe anything they have posted, as they are obviously not seasoned travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Location..location...location”
Reviews.Author: bobkr
Reviews.Content: Great loc..great serv ice staff...grumpy desk...avg bkfst....not fancy but does job...clean gd wifi

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Corot, Rome - a good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: GautamMu
Reviews.Content: Very close to the termini station & the bus stand and it is a boon for visitors. There are pharmacies, stores, wine shops and restaurants within a few minutes walk. The hotel decor is old and not the best at the common areas (probably because it shares the elevator and a passage with another hotel). The rooms are rather small but very clean and the toilet is of reasonable size and clean too. The hotel staff is very friendly and polite, Mario at the reception is particularly helpful. The breakfast room is bright and the breakfast is adequate. They might look at changing the menu once in a while though. Free wi-fi in the room is definitely a bonus. For its price it is good value and I shall recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: jangale
Reviews.Content: Right across the road from Termini station (look for via Marsala exit). We took the Leonardo express train from the airport (worth the money). At first you think, "What am I letting myself in for" but the concierge desk is friendly, the price is reasonable, and the accommodation is better than expected. The breakfast room is bright and there are lots of choices. You can take the subway system and many attractions are a doable walk.Make sure you have good walking shoes. Watch for the gypsies at the train station - they ask for money for helping you get subway tickets from the machine, and there are some outside the hotel at times selling knock-off merchandise. Just walk with a purpose, not by yourself. This is a really good place to stay for a few days if you are doing Rome on your own (be sure you do the New Free Rome Tour your first night!).

Reviews.Title: “good place for short stay”
Reviews.Author: dtaddeo
Reviews.Content: very close to Termini station, where you can find market, pharmacy, stores, phone companies, etc. Always felt safe in the area. The hotel staff very helpful and friendly. Rooms little small , but functional and clean. Very clean bathroom. Pretty good breakfast and the best cappucino ever.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: samreeti
Reviews.Content: We had to stay here overnight before boarding a flight from rome the next morning. It was very conveniently located wrt the termini( just 3 mins away) and the quadruple room was surprisingly spacious given the location of the hotel. The air-conditioning was also excellent and the receptioninst was very helpful in suggesting the best way to travel to the airport( otherwise I doubt we would have have caught our flight on time!). The breakfast was very good and considering the price paid, it was a very good choice overall for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lemondrizzle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November and I just wanted to pass on some tips and my thoughts. It is very convenient in terms of it's closeness to the train station,so no having to trek around town when you get in. The area is a bit like kings Cross in that it attracts people who are homeless and you do see the harder side of Rome when you are around there. Once you have acclimatised to the location, it has lots of benefits, is good for food outlets for fastish food and coffee, there is a supermarket nearby, the tourist buses and all the other transport is also close by and getting home is much less hassle. The hotel itself is joined with the Rimni Hotel and you walk through their lobby to get to the lift, the carpet on the staircase is very well worn and doesn't look great. The room was very clean but the walls were stained as other people have mentioned, the breakfast was fine better on one day than the next, one day lots of choice of cakes another just croissants and other things of course. I advise to just try orange juice from the machine not the mixed juice. Cappucino from machine was nice. Staff were mixed, all the staff within the hotel were lovely and one receptionist was also very nice but a couple of reception staff were quite officious and not warm at all. TV, make sure you use the menu function of the control as if you just flick through the numbers you just get 4 channels. If you use the menu function you get CNBC etc. but only a few English Speaking mainly news. Finding the hotel is easy once you know how. Exit the station through a very large exit, if you see McDonalds, turn around and look the opposite way, you should see another large exit and when you get close to it, look up and you will see a sign saying Via Marsala which is the correct road exit, the road opposite and vertical is Via Marghera and the hotel is just a few yards on the right on that road. To find the Spa supermarket near hotel, exit hotel road and turn and walk left, you will see a covered walkway across the road, the supermarket is a 100 yards further down, it's not that obvious. One of the big tourist bus routes terminates near the hotel, I have forgotten their name but I tend to use them in most cities and if you keep your ticket you get a 10% discount in the next city, I always forget to keep my ticket! Exit the hotel and turn right, the stop is just 20 yards on the station side. They run 2 routes and one goes to this stop but I have the feeling that in the winter they run one route on alternate days, although this is not advertised but they tell you before you buy the ticket if either route is not running, I think the route that goes close to the hotel starts at 30 and 60 mins but you should check this. Re the hotel, I think it is suitable for budget travellers who have realistic expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,”
Reviews.Author: pennyblossam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Corot for two nights, very close to Termini Station. Some parts of the hotel are better than other, beds and bathroom were clean, but let down by the grimey wallpaper. Don't know if all the rooms were the same of we were just unlucky. Reception staff very friendly and buffet breakfast of good startard which was taken in a clean modern area. Very reasonable price for room, shame about a few shabby areas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 72Niki
Reviews.Content: Me and my travel buddy stayed here in early November for 3 nights. The room was as described. It was plain and a little darkish because of the dark wood ceiling, but not unappealing. It was clean, the bathroom was clean, and the twin beds were comfortable enough so that was good to me. The shower is a square stall and I am a tall, average sized woman and I would not have been able to shave my legs in there without a lot of difficulty. So if you are a big person, this would be uncomfortable for you to get into and certainly to turn around in. There was a bidet in there which we didn't use because we don't like them and it is positioned across from the toilet, not next to it, so you are looking at it when you sit on the toilet. It was clean but I would rather not have looked at it so much. The breakfast was not just a little pastry as a couple people complained. Perhaps they came very late? It was from 7a-10a and we got there about 8-9am every day. There were several pastries, breads, hard boiled eggs, slices of ham and slices of cheese, cereals, a small selection of fruit, and a machine that delivered several types of hot drinks from different coffees to hot milk, to hot chocolate. It was not breakfast at the Ritz but it was a good selection for a budget hotel and we enjoyed our breakfasts. My only complaint and the reason I took away a full star is because the man at the front desk during the day was not very friendly or helpful. So that is the star for customer service. He barely greeted us and didn't even smile when we arrived although I greeted him in Italian (which I have studied a little) and then wanted my print out confirmation of the hotel reservation even though it was already paid for, which he said he knew, and we had already shown him our passports. Of the 3 hotels we stayed at on our trip (one in Paris and the other in Florence) he was the only one who not only asked to see it, but kept it. I found that a little odd but whatever. We found his attitude the most most annoying the day before we left. We asked how much a taxi would be from the hotel to the airport (which is a 1/2 block away from the Termini if you exit the Termini from the right side of the building rather than the front) - incredibly convenient by the way) and he said he didn't know because it's different price from the airport vs to the airport. Also that there would be a night fee (we had to leave before 5am). He waved us off and told us to ask one of the taxis at the Termini. We found this to be incredibly rude and felt he was lying. To work there and have no idea how much a taxi ride to the airport is?? Please. We proceeded to our room and spent over an hour trying to figure it out on our laptop via the free WiFi. We realized 3 things 1) there is a legally set price 40Euro to and from the airport from Termini and 2) there is no night surcharge. However, some taxi drivers will try and cheat you so look for the white taxis with the official symbol on the passenger door and establish the price before you zoom off. However, more importantly we 3) found a bus that runs from 12mn to 5am leaving maybe 4 times in that range, that goes from the Termini to Fiumicino airport and is only 4.50Euro (ten times less than a taxi!), and maybe 7Euro if you buy your ticket on the bus. The bus company is called "Cotral". You can find a vendor on the opposite side of the Termini (where all the buses come in and out) that sells tickets and they can tell you where to find that bus stop. Otherwise, if you can leave at a normal hour, just take the metro from the Termini. So the hotel was very conveniently located but the location is a little seedy for those of you who need to be in a nice area. For us the location couldn't have been better and there are 3 levels, of shops, food places, and trains, buses in the Termini. We took the metro at the Termini to the Colosseum and to get to Vatican City. So the location was highly convenient, breakfast was good, room was perfectly fine. Just not great customer service. But the maid was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: RosaSaoPaulo_Brazil Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We first went to a hotel that was awful. Then we start looking for a hotel nearby termini station. We found this hotel, that had a very agreable guy, and we payd a very fair price. Breakfast, air conditioning, wireless and they also could save our luggages after the check out! Room was very good, with frigobar. Less that one block from termini station - perfect!

Reviews.Title: “If you have reasonable expectations you will be perfectly happy”
Reviews.Author: Kaz1985
Reviews.Content: The main thing I look for in a hotel is it is clean and hygenic and Hotel Corot certainly was -I couldn't criticise the cleanliness at all. Sheets and towels were changed everyday. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived (very early, 11.30am) but when we returned to the hotel 20 minutes later our room was ready and our bags had even been taken up for us. The room wasn't large by any means, but there was more than enough space for us to spread out. We were very pleasantly surprised by the bathroom, which was a good size, newly decorated and even had a bidet and jacuzzi bath. The lift is tiny and only fits 2 people and their bags but that is a minor criticism. It wouldn't have been out of place in an upmarket hotel. The breakfast is a bog standard continental but is regularly restocked and they will make you fresh coffee if you ask, rather than using a vending machine. The location is very good. 1 minute walk from the Termini means you can get any where, and is ideal for getting the train from the airport and using the Metro. If you turn right out of the hotel there are 3 nice restaurants along the street although there isnt too much else around. It is worth going to the restaurants in the side streets on the other side of the Termini. The staff were helpful with directions, gave us a choice of rooms and although we didn't have any problems I'm sure they would have handled them well. Anyone who has criticised the hotel on here seems to have had ridiculous expectations when they are paying a comparatively low price. Anyway, all in all a good option, I would recommend it/stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I would gladly stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: GSPtravelguy
Reviews.Content: We just returned and were very pleased with the Hotel Corot. the location was perfect. Very clean and very nice continental breakfast offered.

Reviews.Title: “Everything trip advisor said it would be...and more!”
Reviews.Author: kmarq55
Reviews.Content: We had just finished a cruise and traveled to Rome by train to Termini station. Just a block away sat our hotel, the Corot. Which meant the metro, and trains were right at our disposal. It was so easy, and our room was on a quiet street away from the station. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was easy to get to, just off the charming older elevator. Our housekeeper was very helpful with orienting us, and kept us well stocked with things for the bathroom. The breakfast was everything a European breakfast should be...nice breads, meat and cheese, coffee and juice. The wireless internet was fast and reliable. If ever I find myself in Rome again, I will book at the Corot!

Reviews.Title: “"Lovely honeymoon!"”
Reviews.Author: Tanrmc
Reviews.Content: We are having great time at this hotel. All ratings are clearly giving 5 star! But only with the shower place is really tide and hardly can turn (not recommend for big size guys) Recommending all my friends to have a stay there as they are friendly and helpful staff (even not in fluent english!) Room is clean and tidy. I can recall my room 102 looks bit classic for furniture, but really feel happy to stay (as the size of the room is big!). Travel? You can't imagine that from Hotel to Station Termini is SUPER near!

Reviews.Title: “Best location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RonaLim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from June 21 to 24. Couldn't have asked for a better location – 2 minutes' walk to Termini Train Station, buses and metro. The location was important for us especially because we had a late train coming in from Florence on one of the nights and didn't want to have to walk a long distance at almost 11 at night, after hearing too many stories about robberies and pickpockets in Rome. Pleasantly surprised that the place around Termini was still bustling with commuters and tourists that night, probably because it was summer with longer daylight. Lots of places around to eat and buy water and snacks. Within the Termini station itself, there were several eateries, a huge bookstore, newspaper vendors and a shopping mall in its basement. Around Corot, many small restaurants serving reasonably priced meals. We had a 15-euros meal at Ristorante "Alla Lupa" a few steps away from Corot, comprising a starter (soup or pasta), main course (turkey or chicken), choice of salad or potatoes, choice of dessert or coffee. The spaghetti bolognaise I ordered was a meal unto itself! Hotel service at Corot was really great. We arrived at about 9+ in the morning, not sure if we were too early to check-in and prepared to wait or roam around before they had a room for us. Very happy to be checked-in immediately! Check-in was hassle free, less than 5 minutes. We were shown to our room by a very energetic, practically bursting with positiveness lady by the name of Tina. She was super strong, grabbed our 2 huge heavy luggage into the tiny lift and then ran 3 floors up to help us haul the bags into the room! I was amazed not just by her strength and speed but also by her very positive smiling attitude. What a great welcome! We later also saw Tina doing the housekeeping, as well as helping out at the breakfast room. She was everywhere and always with a great smile! It made a huge difference to our stay! The manageress (sorry, I forgot to take the name) was also extremely nice, ushering us in and allowing us to start breakfast early at 6+ when they usually opened for breakfast at 7. Breakfast was wonderful. Before checking in to this hotel, we were touring Italy with a large tour group and stayed at 6 different hotels, a few of which were international hotel chains. None of their breakfasts came close to Corot's, which had 2 kinds of cold cuts, cheese, pastries, toast, selection of crackers, pate, jam, fruit cocktail and peaches, cereal, juice, tea and selection of coffee from the machine - expresso, americano, mocha. For some reason, Capuccino was freshly brewed and individually served. Everything was free flow. The only thing they didn't have was eggs, which was okay for us after having too much of it anyway earlier on. The room was simple but sufficient space to place our 2 huge luggage plus some other shopping bags. Simple wardrobe with plentiful supply of hangers. Safe deposit box provided. Morning call was activated by using the phone in the room which was convenient and didn't require calling down to reception every night. Limited number of TV channels which all appeared to be in Italian but it didn't really matter to us as we reached back quite late every night and just went to bed. Toiletries provided were shampoo/bath gel, soaps, toothbrush, box of tissues (which seemed a rare thing as most earlier hotels did not provide tissues). Also large bath towels, hand towels and separate towels for bidet. Housekeeping was very good - thanks Tina! Very clean and thorough. The only thing that we didn't particularly like was that the air-con was kept turned off in the day and if you returned early in the evening, you would return to a room that's not cool. A request to reception got it turned on immediately though. I guess it's quite a good thing actually, as it's eco-friendly. All in all, a great friendly safe place to stay in Rome and great value! Tip: If you have heavy trolley luggage, it's better to enter by the Hotel Remini entrance. It's just next door to Corot, which has steps leading up to its reception - Remini's entrance doesn't have steps. The 2 hotels are sort of joined in every way and share the same lift too. Have a friend watch the bags while you hop over to Corot reception next door to check in. You will pass by Remini reception again when you head for the lift to your room.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: suguna2202
Reviews.Content: My objective was to see the city, so even though it was an average, I was only going back to the hotel to shower and sleep. Other than that it jus a stone throw location from the train station. About 40 mins from the airport. But there are buses from the airport to the hotel locations for 4-6 euros for each person.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, very helpful”
Reviews.Author: HappyVacation016
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in such a convenient location. It was one street away from Tremini Train station. So you are able to catch metro conveniently as they alway come through to the main Train station. We were able to take a commuter train to the airport at the end of our stay. I would not suggest taking an overnight train, or buying tickets on line. Our seats were sold to 3 different set of people and we ended up standing with no one to help us. The hotel was great. It offered a buffet breakfast of cold cuts, bread, pastries, cereal, juices and as many espresso or capacinos that you could drink. This was great in the mornings not having to go out and look for breakfast before going to the sites, The rooms were average size for Europe with high ceilings. We had an ample bathroom. The staff is definitely helpful in suggesting routes to all the sites. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Old Rome”
Reviews.Author: Stubbies35
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in May, About a 30 sec walk from the Roma temini, pretty well across the road. Rooms are very clean, as well as bathroom, this is more of an old style room, we had a bit of street noise at night, which wasn't to bad, not enough to put you off staying. Breakfast was very adequate and filling, staff are fantastic. this is another place to stay which makes a great base. Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Great location - decent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: JulieL0ves2Travel
Reviews.Content: Very close to Termini Train Station, be sure to exit the Station through the doors marked Via Marsala (if you exit the Station and there's a McDonald's across the street, you went out the wrong doors). Our room and our friends'room were both very clean, mattresses were very firm but that's okay with us. Bathrooms recently remodeled on our floor. Calling downstairs to have the air-conditioning turned on was a little odd, but whenever we called, it immediately started. Breakfast was very good, especially the Cappuccino.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a few days in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: alinvicen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Corot for 4 nights while in Rome 2010. So close to the train station, and with relatively low prices, we actually didn´t expect much – but were pleasantly surprised. Our room was located on the second floor and had a window facing the small street outside. Despite this it was quiet most of the time and we barely heard anything from the other guests. The best thing about our room was the bathroom, which was very fresh and looked newly renovated. The rest of our room didn’t really have that “newly renovated” feeling but was well kept. The same can be said for other hotel areas such as the reception and the dining room. Nothing exceptional, but also nothing to complain about. I wouldn't use the elevator in the building though, it stopped working more than once during our stay. Other than that the staff was nice and helpful, which made our stay really great.

Reviews.Title: “great location for airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: BertienBryce
Reviews.Content: I liked the Corot, though I wasn't too impressed when I first arrived. The area is a bit grotty, being so near to the station, and the decor in the actual bedrooms is rather strange. However, it grew on me. The area is a bit scruffy but it is bustling and has loads of little bars and restaurants and is quite literally 2 minutes across the road from the Termini and the same distance from the Ciampino drop off/pick up point. I found the staff to be friendly and speak good English, and the breakfasts were good, lots of choice and decent coffee. The room was clean, beds comfy and I liked the bathroom and shower. And the shutters and double glazing kept out most of the street noise even though there was builders working opposite. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for our needs!”
Reviews.Author: careymfm
Reviews.Content: The street that the Corot Hotel is on is right in line with doors of the main train station, Termini Roma, which was a great location for us since we would be taking the Leonardo Express to the airport the next morning. The train station is like a mall with shops and surprisingly good food. Check it out! There are many hotels in the area and we chose this one from tripadvisor reviews for the free buffet breakfast and the free WiFi. It was the off-season, December 1st, so it definitely wasn't noisy and we didn't have to worry about the air conditioning since it was cold outside. The hotel personnel were very kind and helpful and they even opened the breakfast buffet early for us since we had to leave early for the airport. Very kind. Our room on the third floor was big with a king bed and a twin bed, a refrigerator and a jacuzzi tub (but the jets didn't work so that was disappointing). They also had a lot of English channels on the TV. We enjoyed our stay here for one night.

Reviews.Title: “best choice & within budget :)”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyKeh
Reviews.Content: this hotel is well located which is just less than 2minutes walk from the Termini, main station. hotel room is clean & spacious. toilet is pretty & clean. for sure i'll check-in to Corot Hotel on my next trip to Rome :)

Reviews.Title: “Just a notch above a hostel”
Reviews.Author: LateforEverything
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the positives. This hotel's location is within a 2 min walk from Roma Termini station. Now the negatives, unfriendly staff - we had to switch rooms after the first night because the staff said our room had an extra bed and wanted to accommodate a family traveling. We had arrived around 6pm on a Friday and they would put us in any other room and said all rooms were occupied. Unlike the states, there is no arguing or negotiating in Rome, it's take it or leave it. They seem annoyed when you ask them questions about recommendations on where to eat and places to see nearby. I guess hospitality is not something they are concerned with. There is no AC switch in the room, you must call front desk to turn it on. The front desk will also automatically turn off the AC around 7:30 in the morning without any consideration that you may still be in your room. Temper your expectations - if you just want a place to sleep and not be bothered, this may be okay for you.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and location.”
Reviews.Author: Nabil d
Reviews.Content: If what your looking for is a hotel close to the train and metro station this hotel is it , its just across the street from the station .the hotel room is clean and comfortable . the air conditioning is on demand at the front desk , staff very helpful .breakfast is very good and the lady makes great cappuccinos. very animated area but very safe police all over the place . Rome is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “its a great hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: ettygershon
Reviews.Content: we had a very nice room , service was very good and clean room it was very close to the central bus station lot of shops and restaurand ther. i was in room 204 etty gershon and ben hamo ruth

Reviews.Title: “great location for first time visit to rome”
Reviews.Author: aureliusjackson
Reviews.Content: this place is right across the street from termini so the location is perfect to get to some of the main tourist points. it was a little dingy but clean overall. size was decent for european standards. i thought the breakfast service was great and we loved the capuccino machine. helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rhodesm
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is one block from the Roma Train Terminal and is a 20-30 minute walk to the colsseum. The hotel is strange since every other floor either belongs to Hotel Corot or Hotel Rimini ( I would avoid this hotel at all cost). Out of our 13 day trip this was our least favorite hotel due more to the uneasy feeling we had staying at this hotel. Clean, food was ok, service was average.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the main Station”
Reviews.Author: chiquibabe
Reviews.Content: This is not a very centric hotel, but it is walking distance to the main train station and buses. We weren’t able to find a bus schedules and lines, but bought the Rome pass that was very helpful to get around the places we wanted to go (through metro). The rooms were spacious and very clean. We had a view of the street. There are tons of restaurants close by but there are not very good, and they were pricy for the food. We walk around six blocks to find a Napolitalian restaurant that was very good. We only had one problem with the hotel; the air-conditioning was either too strong or not strong enough and can only be controlled by the main control room.

Reviews.Title: “well situated for the attractions”
Reviews.Author: bobwinmill
Reviews.Content: i stayed recently at the hotel corot in rome. superbly situated for the railway station and the rome metro(although there are only 2 lines). the hotel itself, was clean. room service every day. the breakfasts were quite good - the usual continental fare. the coffee machine itself was a bit hit and miss, but the waitress would always make you a fresh capuccino or latte. the staff were very helpful. all in all, quite a decent hotel but could start to look a little tired in a few years, but that is only nitpicking.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the only Reason to Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynTraveler4
Reviews.Content: If you exit Central Station to the right, it is a one minute walk to the hotel, which is ideal if you are catching a very early train or the train to the airport (very convenient). Otherwise, you can do much, much better elsewhere. The two men at the desk when we arrived and departed were rude and surly. One insisted on finishing his cigarette before he helped us. The room and bathroom were clean and serviceable but very small. The window opened onto an air chute. The bed was hard as a rock. For reasons unclear to me we exited the Hotel Corot and re-entered Hotel Rimini to get to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Some good but mostly bad”
Reviews.Author: Slainte-Unadilla
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Corot late on a Monday night, which is only a short walk from Termini Station, (unless you exit out of the station on the wrong side as we did, and ended up needing a cab ride to the hotel). The man at the desk was the most unpleasant, rude, obnoxious person we have ever had the misfortune of running into on any of our travels to Europe or the US. When we were done checking in with Mister Miseable we all had a sick feeling about Italy and wished that we were back in Ireland. When we went to get in the elevator we discovered that only one person could get in without any luggage. (I actually think it was the dumbwaiter, not the elevator.) So we then lugged our luggage up three flights of stairs covered with red carpet. (We thought it was red anyway, the dirt on the carpet was so bad that it was really hard to tell what color it was). We arrived at the room and opened the door. Fortunately Freddie Krueger was not still in the room but the black mold on the walls was. We all looked at each other and decided to suck it up and spend one night then look for another hotel, forfeiting the next prepaid three nights. To add insult to injury when I hopped in the shower to wash the black mold of f I discovered we had no hot water in the shower. What a way to start a holiday in Italy! Fortunately we found the people at the desk in the morning to be much friendlier and the continental breakfast was adequate. We did end up staying the other three nights but only because there were no rooms available elsewhere. Bottom line, we would not recommend this hotel to anyone unless you were looking for an idea for a horror movie.....starting with the miserable man at the reception desk at night. We would recommend that he learn how to smile and appreciate customers or get out of the hotel business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ifolays
Reviews.Content: We book this hotel through otel.com and had no problem at all. Excellent location, very close to Termini Station and nice places to eat anything fast. Reception employees were nice. The triple bedroom was ok, and we found the bathroom spacious and clean. We had dinner at a close restaurant Il Nazareno and it was full with locals, good pasta and wine. We would certainly stayed here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel Has Everything You Need--Safe Quiet..Busy area stay alert”
Reviews.Author: kingfan100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually a little better than I expected. I traveled with my daughter and we had a room with a couch that turned into a single bed however the king was so large we ended up sleeping on that and using the couch to hold our suitcase and stuff. My parents had the room next to us and also had a king bed but no place to put there suitcase so they liked our room better. The layout of the bathroom was different and they had problems with water leaking out of the shower. The shower pressure and temp is wonderful and we had no problems with water leakage because there was a slight lip that kept the water in. No place to set bottles in the shower but we just put on floor. We both complained of sewer smell once in awhile from the bathroom but it usually didn't last more than an hour. We would just open the window and flush the toilet and it seemed to go away. At night the only thing I could hear was sound of water running above me. I think it was others showering but it went on till wee hours in the am so I always travel with a sound machine and once i turn that on i sleep uninterrupted. The area is very busy because of the train station but we loved the convience to transportation the grocery stores and there is a internet place with computers 2 doors down for $5 an hour but not open real late. There other places nearby cheaper and we tried them, too, since the other ones are open 24 hours $2 an hour aprox. There is a cafe a block further away from the station on the corner and we had small noodle soup and it was like chicken noodle with tiny pieces of noodle and broth. Hit the spot on a cold night. The breakfast is wonderful! My daughter loved the cappacino maker. We had that thing cranking out american coffee, cappicino's, expresso and it made other stuff, too. There was oatmeal,cereal,yogurt,meat,cheese,granola,toast,italian bread,rye bread,prunes,canned peaches,prepacked little pastries, also regular pastries,donuts,croissants. Enough to choose from. Im hard to please and I was a HAPPY healthy eatter. I hate those places that serve digusting fatty breakfast stuff. Here you had at least a choice. Two morning we had tours that picked up at 6:50, so we went down at 6:30 and the staff flew around gettting the food out early so we could eat before we left. Breakfast doesn't start till 7am so we were surprised that they jumped into action and wanted us to eat. The staff is very quiet and doesn't say much but they really seem to want to give you want is described on there website. Not much into the other stuff with tours or internet. In the states I usually stay at Hilton Brand hotels, so this was definatly different, but we are barely in the room and i was trying to stay in my budget. Yes the room did have black stuff on the walls under the cloth cusioned wallpaper but it didn't smell and the building is really old so i guess it's to be expected. Everything was mostly clean, just old and i like that the floors are wooden not carpeting. The bathroom is totally tiled and mostly clean the walls could use a scrubbing. I like the little frig to keep our stuff in. They have it filled with stuff to buy but we just set that stuff aside and bought our own stuff. No problem from them and no extra charge. Made a few local calls and that was 10 cents each. The hotel just needs a place to make coffee or tea in the evenings and it would be absolutely perfect. It's 4 to 6 euros for a coffee/tea in a cafe and you don't get any refills so we got tired of drinking cold water in the room. I never asked at the hotel but didn't see anything offered. There is a safe in the room and I used it. Works a little different than in the states but i figured it out. The Tv is also wierd but there is only a couple of news channels in english so we only had it on for short times anyway. They have cable but just a few channels in english and then lots of other languages. We stayed a week, so if you have any questions feel free to ask. We used the Viator website to book our trips to Assissi and pompeii. Also the vatican tour and the Collesium tour. We liked everything we did. The tours guides were good except the bus guide on the assissi/orviento tour was a little lazy so we never really knew what was going on but the local guides were good--the tour was suppose to include tasting local produce--ugh it was yuckie crap they took us to this place where we had lunch they have a little store in the back. It was small and they had only one wine sample very bitter and the other stuff wasn't good either. Lunch was ok but I didn't eat it.--it was pasta in alfredo type sauce with meat and I'm vegetarian. The pompeii trip the tour guide had lots of information and she even took menu choices for vegan's so that trip was alot better. We went to the Villa Borghese--need reservations!!! and the cute zoo which costs i think $10 euros each, but what a hassle using public transportation to get here. Got there cheap but it was eventful. We only used public transporation which saves alot of money. My dad got pickpocketed on the metro the second day. Even had his wallet chained and zipped and they unzipped it grabbed the cash and ran as soon as the doors opened. Think the girls were working as a group so watch out!!! Keep everything out of sight and preferrable under clothing or leave in safe in room. If you get hungry for a burger Hard Rock Cafe was wonderful. It was like being back home, which after 5 days my family enjoyed eatting here. I liked my salad, too.

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel ...Right price, Right location ..Thumbs up !”
Reviews.Author: John-manassas
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights last week. Better then I even expected for the price. Only 50 yards from the Roma Terminal. Street is still fairly quite and the location seemed safe to me and my wife, son and in-laws. The breakfest was very good. The staff is very profesional and helpfull. The rooms were clean and I was surprised that I couldnt hardly even hear any street noise , and no noise form the other rooms. The elevator is very small so it may take a couple of trips up/down for your luggage..no big deal All in all , a big thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Jac48904
Reviews.Content: I Spent a week in this hotel with my Girlfriend during my first visit to Rome. The hotel is located directly opposite Termini station, very convenient for access to Rome’s Metro lines and airport train. The room was clean and very comfortable and the bathroom was modern and looked like a recent refurbishment. The hotel offers a free Wifi service which is free and easy to access (reception will give you access code) I had breakfast included in my holiday, it was very good quality with a selection of cold meats, pastries, fruit etc…

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elise123
Reviews.Content: Apartment from the close location to Termini Station there is nothing good to say about this hotel. The room was small and dark with a view straight into a backyard surrounded with walls. The bathroom was also very small. There was at times a bad smell from the bathroom after using the toilet or shower. Breakfast was ok but that was it. Pictures from the rooms on different web sites is not the reality.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with good pricing”
Reviews.Author: tangibleprseence
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on a last minute booking as the previous B&B that we booked was at a very dangerous zone. We booked through an agent and it cost about 20% more than what the hotel receptionist charge us. But this hotel has the best location-you just walked out of the train station and cross the road, and there is Hotel Corot! The service is good. The room is clean. I would go back to this hotel on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Great Location, and Very Spacious!”
Reviews.Author: no1010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in an amazing location! You litterally walk out of the Rome-Termini Station, cross the street and walk about 10 feet and There's the hotel! amazing!..also It is very spacious, the service is great! and the bathroom is nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - basic rooms”
Reviews.Author: daveuk101
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close (100 metres) from main railway station in Rome (Termini) - noise was minimal despite this, even on 2nd floor although was back-facing room. Room was quite basic - great if you just need somewhere to sleep although probably not somewhere to stay in during day. Was clean and quite reasonable. Staff were friendly and spoke good english. There is WiFi but for some reason didn't reach my bedtroom so had to use hallway/reception area. Breakfast was good spead of cold buffet. If staying in Rome again would look what else is available but think for this price, this hotel is good value and would consider staying here agian.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for recommended tour lines and promises”
Reviews.Author: AlmostFamousRocker
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8 day stay at this hotel. Lived up to most of the reviews; clean room, breakfast & great location. Pricy for this hotel. Under no circumstances should you use their recommended tour lines. GREEN LINE TOURS IS THE WORST! STAY AWAY FROM THEM. The room was on the hotel Remi side & both need a makeover. My room faced the backside of an apartment building. There was construction taking place nextdoor so if you are a lite sleeper, I do not recommend room 101. The cleaning staff, all women, were wonderful, smiled always & greeted you each time they saw you & all speak English. The men have that european attitude about women. Breakfast was good but it sure could use some american food. There was WiFi but for two days it was difficult to connect. The net also had a special that if you had an extended stay you would get a choice of hotel transfer to the airport but it was never validated. I would use Stefano from Roma Cabs. As an added note..The hotel desk was not very accomodating to single female travelers and asking questions seemed to be a chore more than a service..male attitudes in Italy. Overall, I would stay there again and recommended this hotel. Bring a clock with you, as none in the room. P.S. the tv remote did not work and only CNN was avaialable for English speakers.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomawok
Reviews.Content: Just perfect, about 50m from main train station and really comfortable hotel. Breakfast is good and the coffee....as it taste only in Roma. You can from there visit the all city by foot, and need to use the public transportation just to the airport. Staff is just perfect. So I would definitively recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms: Good for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Morphi
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Rome several times now, it is always a struggle to find a decent standard hotel for euro100 or less for a double. We wanted to stay next to Termini as we were arriving by train. Also we needed a single, a double, a twin, a triple and a quad as we were a family travelling together. This fitted the bill perfectly and was really about 50 metres from Termini. Small rooms - most of the hotel rooms in Rome are small, not big enough for me to do my yoga stretches. Really nice buffet breakfast. Staff were happy to recomend close resturants etc. Shower only - no bath. No tea or coffee making facilities. Couldn't open the shutters to let daylight in. Climate temp is controlled by the reception - just call. Hotel has a small lift (which it shares with Hotel Rimini), and we found we used the stairs all the time as the elevator was constantly in use. Free wifi (although we had a problem on our floor one day and used the wifi in the lobby instead). At Termini is lots of shops including a supermarket - just down the escalator to the left. Happy to recommend this hotel for good value close to the station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Clean but very tired and used,Good breakfast, Noisey.”
Reviews.Author: REBEKKER
Reviews.Content: Location to train station is about 70m. and an easy walk with bags. Very accessable to The Red Bus Service for your on/off circuit tours. The service was friendly and helpful and when I made an error with the safe, they helped me immediately. The room was clean and sheets changed daily, but the bed was hard and the pillows flat. The bath clothesline wouldn't extract and the basin taps were stiff to operate. The bath shower was confined, with a curtain which was annoyingly clinging to the body, whilst showering. Other bathroom amenities were good. The breakfast was was good with cereals, fruit, toast and cold boiled eggs, pastries, toppings for toast and coffee & tea provided. Our room faced the street and with windows closed was still noisey at night. Unfortunately, the walls are to thin and you can hear what 's going on in the other rooms. Overall, the hotel is a little tired in its presentation, but generally the accommodation for its location is good.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: 1/2 way between Seattle and Vancouver BC
Reviews.Title: “Vive Italia, Vive Roma, Vive Hotel Corot!”
Reviews.Author: a_way_gone_cat
Reviews.Content: We love the Corot. This place is a great value, and is our ‘go-to’ hotel for Rome. It's just a block from the termini, and it’s quiet bliss from the hustle and bustle of Rome. The Corot shares a building with the Hotel Rimini, ( I think they split the floors), and is old school Rome right down to it’s bird-cage elevator. The rooms and common areas are a little worn, and just as relaxed as you please. I feel very at home at the Corot The guy at the desk has been there for years and is always very helpful and pleasant. The breakfast room is comfortable, and the food is good. The location is less than a block North of the station. We are usually wiped out from travelling when we get to Rome. It’s usually our first stop after flying over from North America. The Corot is a great place to get to for 10 hours of much needed quiet and sleep after arriving in Italy.They have free high speed wifi, with the code from the desk. It’s quiet, comfortable, and there’s no better place to dust off your glamorous-meets-funky Italian fashion for an energizing visit to the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “good location and good value with clean room”
Reviews.Author: vyhward
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, walking distance to train station, subways, restaurants. Room is comfortable, standard but clean. Bathroom is updated and clean better than I expected for a small hotel. Not for fussy travellers

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller71
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Corot as it was so near to the train station - less than a two minute walk, which was very convenient. It is about 20 minutes to walk to the main attractions from the hotel, which was fine. The staff are very friendly and the breakfast was good. The room we had was a bit outdated and dingy - but you don't go to Rome to sit in a hotel room. The bathroom was quite possibly the smallest bathroom I've ever seen. You could touch both walls if you stretched out your hands. It was however clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: DTNJLAW
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for three rooms at the Hotel Corot in July 2008. Location is one block from the train station which is very convenient. If I were staying more than one night I would want to be in a much nicer area but it was fine for one night stay. When we got there our rooms were not available and they took us next door to another hotel that was connected. The place was fine, but the elevator was a little scary. Breakfast was on the fifth floor and was very pleasant. Tip: I asked to see my room BEFORE checking in and although they were irritated by the request I ended up with a room significantly larger then my other friends that didn't ask to see the room first. My room was reasonably sized for the price and location, the bathroom was small but clean. The bed was very uncomfortable, I could feel the springs through the mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Giltedge
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed two nights at the Hotel Corot. The reason we selected this hotel was because of its close proximity to the train termini in Rome. When you depart from your train you make a right out of the station, cross the street and walk less than half a block to your hotel's front door. We arrived at 8 in the morning and our room was available. The hotel staff was pleasant and helped us with our bags into the small elevator to the 3rd floor. Our room was clean, queen bed, TV, safe, mini-bar, hard-wood floors with a large bathroom. It had a walk-in shower, toilet, bidet and sink with a hair dryer, large fluffy towels and plenty of toiletries. The air-conditioner was not on because it was too early in the season but we had a large window and the room stayed very comfortable. There is quite abit of noise from the street below but with the window closed you didn't notice it. The breakfast room was very nice and the choices to eat were great (cereal, sweet-rolls, eggs, hard rolls, fresh fruit, cheese, ham, coffee, latte, tea). I would highly recommend this hotel for the traveler like us staying a couple of extra days in Rome after a cruise or just for a convenient place to stay while in Rome. All the main attractions are close by for walking to or by using some type of transportation. We felt safe and wouldn't hesitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cabila77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near to Termini station with good connections for public transportations (subway, bus) in order to cover all the major atractions. The small entrance is for Corot hotel and his sister hotel, the elevator is very small (only 2 people), nice modern breakfast room (breakfast buffet with ham, chees, eggs and cereals, coffe-you can ask for a regular or espresso, very good). The rooms are very small, but very high, without balcony, there is an oudour (smell of "old") in the rooms. The bathrooms are big, renovated and clean. We stayed for 6 nights in march '07 and when we arrived it was raining, it was chilly in the rooms and we have to go down to the reception and ask if it possible to turning on the A/C centralised; the receptionist (few days later I was found out that was the owner himself) did not agree at the beginning but at the end he activated the A/C sistem in our room. We visited other hotels in central Rome (few of them 4* hotels) and we agree that there are problems with accommodation (many of hotels are in the historical buildings, so there can not be renovated totaly, no possibility for balconies), so Corot hotel offers decent accommodation but nothing more, do not have high expectation.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome”
Reviews.Author: helenmack68
Reviews.Content: I have just recently stayed there with two friends in a triple room "211" the room was very spacious and the bathroom was very modern. The walls looked damp but I think just needed cleaning. The breakfast at the hotel was very nice and plentyful the red orange juice was gorgeous and the capacinno was too. The tea unfortunately wasnt very nice (probably the water). The lift only hold 3 people max and thank goodness we were on the 2nd floor as you couldnt catch the lift for love nor money when checking out with your suitcase, so had to drag it down the stairs. The staff are very helpful and friendly and booked us a restaurant 'Gusto very nice, and taxi to. The location was very handy although not very in the middle of it all, which I think I wold have preferred as we had to get taxis to and from everywhere. There are people selling dodgy goods outside the hotel but to be honest they never bothered us at all. All in all I would recommend this hotel for price and quality but not for being in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: steveandian
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed 4 nights at this hotel. Although as said in other reviews the surroundings are a little rough we decided to take a chance. I am glad we did as the hotel was in a very convenient location, literally 1 minute walk to the Termini (Main station) with connections to all parts of rome and a great starting point to explore the city. Also the main bus station is next to the station and the open top city bus tours start from here. The area itself is not really touristy but we never spent much time here. The station itself has many modern shopping facilities and there are many restauants in the surrounding area if you dont like venturing to far from the hotel for a meal in the evening. The hotel was just right for us. Not luxurious but very clean and comfortable rooms with a modern bathroom. No bath but a very impressive shower unit, which I must admit we had a few laughs trying to figure out how it worked as there were many different features.Our room was cleaned daily to a very high standard. The staff all spoke very good english and were polite, friendly and helpful. On arrival we were checked in with no problems and one of the staff took our cases to the small lift and said she would meet us outside our room. She had to walk up to the third floor as there was only room for us and our case. She met us and showed us how the door opened and how the lighting worked and wished us a pleasant stay. There is a safety deposit box in the room at no extra charge and a useful well stocked mini bar. There is a television but only the news channel is in english and the occasional other programe if you can find it. Breakfast was ample cereals ,fruit, toast ,cheese , meats, yogurts tea and coffee and the breakfast seating area was very pleasant. On leaving the hotel we asked the reception if we could leave our luggage as our flght was due in the afternoon and it was no problem for them. Rome is a beautiful city and even 4 nights was not long enough for us. A recommended day out of the city out is to go to Tivoli and visit the villas with the fountain gardens. It was a very pleasant and memorable day. Would definately love to go back to rome and would stay in the Corot hotel again without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with All The Basics”
Reviews.Author: gardnerma
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in early 2007. Room was cozy, but nice. Very clean with all the essentials. We had read complaints about the street noise, but we did not experience this and found that the windows did an excellent job of blocking noise. The rooms had been updated with new lighting and the bathroom appliances looked new and modern. The elevator was very small (2 people or 1 person with luggage), but there aren't that many floors, so stairs were another option. Breakfast was good, and the staff was helpful. The location was close to bus and train stations, so getting around was easy. Please remember that rooms in this part of the world are just smaller and are not like they are in many other countries. Hotel Corot did not have a large foyer, but there was a small place to sit. It did not have all the extras, but it was a clean place to stay that provided a shower and a bed, which is all you need with as much as there is to see in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Corot is convenient but very basic”
Reviews.Author: jasmyne
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just came back from our stay at the Hotel Corot last week. The hotel is very convenient for those who will be traveling to other cities and will be using the Termini station as it is right outside of the Termini train station. This is definitely a no frills hotel. The hotel itself is a bit older, the elevator lift fits about 2 people maximum, and the rooms and bathroom are quite small. We got a corner room on the 2nd floor with no view and the tv was small and secured on the corner, making it difficult to watch. That being said, we really enjoyed the breakfast. The cappucino was really good and it was accompanied by your choice of croissants, toast, cheese, cereal, and other basics.

Reviews.Title: “Room had Seen better days- very sketchy area”
Reviews.Author: BoxsterRichSD
Reviews.Content: Our Experience was a little different that most of these reviews. As noted here and by others the hotel is located only a block or so from Termini station- Good it you want a quick walk for the train but with the station comes a lot of Riff Raff and the neighborhood reflects that- didn't feel unsafe but quite a few characters and you didn't want to pause too long there at night. Perhaps we caught the end of the season but the carpets on the stairs over the lobby were very dirty and the room had it's own "charms". The walls were fairly bady stained from what appeared to be a prior flood and the wood floor pretty scratched and dinged up as was pretty much all the furniture in the room and the sheet threadcount was pretty much single digit. Finally the TV remote was held together with a lot (a lot) of scotch tape. Functioned but really tacky and this place was certainly not worth the close to $200 EU a night we paid for it. Very dissapointing. On the good side the bathroom was modern and nice, the breakfast good and the staff reasonably helpful. I would really try to get out further away from the Termini station as it's just not a nice area. Previously I had stayed at Hotel Nardizi Americana, which is a R Steves referral and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: ciarak81
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel with other members of our family, it was across the road from the termini station, and quite central. Breakfast was between 7 and 10 am, this consisted of cereals and pastries. The staff were friendly, the rooms were a nice size.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: madge+padge
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Corot for three nights in August along with several other family members for my sister's wedding. The hotel is located very close to the termini station. The staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were on the small side but were fully air conditioned and clean. The mini bar in the room was nicely priced. Continental breakfast is served each morning between 7am and 10am and you have a range of pastries, rolls etc. to choose from. Would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: dabWigan
Reviews.Content: hotel getting a bit worn down. rooms ok a bit on the small side for 2 adults and a teanager. breakfast not to bad toast tea and cereall etc. staff friendly and polite. a big let down for the hotel is the area, termini. full of drunks,tramps and beggars. on our first trip to rome we stayed near the american embassy. much better area. rome well worth a visit just do your homework first.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pietro7
Reviews.Content: Just returned [6/14/07] from Rome…stayed at the Corot [Core-row] Hotel…across the street from the Termini, very handy. Staff was very friendly, in a European sort of way…room was clean, small, exactly what I expected…we [three guys sharing a room] spent our entire time sight-seeing and in the room only sleeping…nice little breakfast (eat up, you’ll save money on meals while in the city)…staff was helpful in finding our way around…one piece of luggage was late arriving in Rome and the staff helped with phoning, etc. and made us feel at ease…Internet café next door; quite handy; also, the bus and trains are a few steps away…the Waldorf it ain’t, but we got what we expected, neat, clean, cheap, handy to terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: mrcookes
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in Hotel Corot for 4 days at the end of May and Imust say it was the perfect location for sightseeing and getting around in Rome. We were able to walk to the Coloseum quite easily and it was also handy to other locations. The hotel is right beside Termini so it was also very close to metro, which was safe and very easy to use. The hotel itself was not too spectacular but it was clean and comfortable and there was a great spread of breakfast, I found the bar quite cheap too, 5 euros for a bottle of beer and a glass of champagne! I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome - check it out!!

Reviews.Title: “Corot? 24 Carat!”
Reviews.Author: fatboyonadiet
Reviews.Content: Can't fault it, very nice and clean and a fairly large room with a decent sized and clean bathroom. Room and hotel seemed to be quiet and not too noisy. Staff were nice and helpful and most spoke a good level of English. Breakfast was nice and a decent variety of foods, cereals, yoghurts, fruit, toast and pastries amongst other stuff. Hotel itself is easy to find and down a quiet street just near Termini, seems to be near the nicer bit of Termini (!). Was a bargain for the price, quality and location.

Reviews.Title: “Almost couldn't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: rosie_rosa
Reviews.Content: Perfect as a base for exploring the city either by foot or by metro, which is right outside the door. The room was clean and well furnished with a little character, but beware of the jets in the "jacuzzi" which are rather violent! Breakfast was great, and just handy to have as part of the stay. The staff were friendly and we found them very helpful in obtaining information about transport, and the like. For the price of this hotel i found it to be a great find... and I mean find as we walked straight past the street on arrival!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Zadok99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in January so that I could catch an international flight out of Europe after time travelling around for both business and pleasure. I needed somewhere close to the Roma Termini station and it was just that. I flew back to Rome on Ryanair and Ryanair service Ciampino airport. The Terravision bus from Ciampino drops you off at Rome Termini and it was simply a short walk to the hotel. The hotel is plain, functional, clean and I found it really good value for money. The only complaint is that the air conditioning is controlled centrally and I prefer my hotel rooms to be really cold so I had to open the window with a subsequent increase in noise. The continental breakfast was fine and it was only a short walk to the station for the Leonardo Express train to Fiumcino airport. I will stay here again if I ever need accommodation close to Roma Termini station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deezoomo
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel. Very convenient to Termini, which means trains, subway, bus and the hop on/hop off bus are only a block away. Our room was small, but clean. The breakfast was good. The staff was not very friendly, but not too bad. We had a small problem with them turning off our air conditioner at night. It was in the 70s and quite warm, but around 10 pm they would turn off the air. I would stay there again though. The neighborhood isn't the prettiest, but we didn't see any in Rome that were. We found a great little neighborhood resturany a couple of blocks down from the hotel where we are dinner every night.

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: greve
Reviews.Content: Good location for Terminii Station. Pretty seedy part of town with people sleeping in the street outside. Breakfast fine. Bathroom was tiny but new, so good. Room badly needed a paint, was dingy and the window looked into a lightwell, over a restaurant. The airconditioning did not seem to work so we had the noise of the restaurant, and the smell of frying, most of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Almost next to the train station”
Reviews.Author: JKWD
Reviews.Content: This hotel commands a very convenient location, almost next to the Termini Station (just 100 meters from its side exit). Thus, it is also close to many food places in and around the Station and subway. There is also a grocery and a fruit stall next to it. The room is really sound-proofed and is quite spacious (according to the European standard). The bathroom is very clean and the breakfast room is nice with reasonable quality of breakfast. The staff are friendly and the tourist information (free maps etc.) available at the reception is good. Although it is true that the hotel does not have many facilities and the lift is really small (sharing with another hotel as well), there is no reason why one should spend much time in the hotel in Rome where there are so many things to see and go outside! After all, it is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: DonGriffiths
Reviews.Content: Modern and newly refurbed, well run, right in the center, good breakfast and very good value for money. Had five nights July 06 no problems , mini bar was very reasonable, air con good (38deg C in Rome )Sat TV . All in all great find. Don.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as it was the only one available for our dates but wow did we srike it lucky. It is very close to the train station and as we were travelling by train it was great. I would say the room could do with a spring clean but the bedding and the bathroom were spotless. Breakfast was super with lots of choice. Even my son had plenty to eat and drink and he can be diificult to please. I was worried about the proximity to the station and it was fairly lively but we did not get harrassed at all. Noise at night not a problem even though we overlooked the street.

Reviews.Title: “A pretty OK hotel for budget conscious travellers”
Reviews.Author: SanFranExplorer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights towards the end of my Italian trip and it ended my vacation with a pretty okay note. The hotel is located right next to the Termini Stazione in a somewhat chaotic area so it may turn some people off. But I chose it for the reason of wanting to be close to the station so I wouldn't miss my early morning train to the airport and it worked out just fine. There are quite a few hotels around this area and if you want a budget hotel at a central and convenient spot with easy access to public transportation, you couldn't do wrong with this one. Hotel is operated inside an old building sharing the space with Hotel Rimini. My room was small and a bit dark (facing people's back windows) but otherwise adaquately furnished with typical single room facilities. Standard size of bathroom/shower for single traveller (small but functional). Breakfast is served on the first floor right next to the hall with ok selection of coffee, milk, juice, cereal, yogurt and pastries, etc. No interent facilities on premise at all - would have been nice but there is an internet point right next to the hotel in case people need it. Front desk staff was very professional and one female staff in the morning was particularly friendly and helpful. In all, I had a good stay and wouldn't mind recommending the hotel to anyone who travels on a budget.
